Detailed Description

Definitions for SPE any-type operations.

Define Documentation

#define CTK_SPE_CONTEXT ( spe   ) 

Value:

(CTK_SPE_TYPE(spe) == CTK_SPE_CONTEXT_T) \
            ? ((ctk_spe_context_t)spe) \
            : ctk_spe_thread_get_context(CTK_SPE_THREAD(spe))
A macro to get SPE context from SPE any object

#define CTK_SPE_NATIVE ( spe   )     _CTK_SPE_NATIVE(CTK_SPE_CONTEXT(spe))

Macro to obtain internal(native) SPE structure for the given SPE object.

Parameters:
[in] spe - SPE
Returns:
native SPE
Note:
vendor-library-dependent modules must provide a macro _CTK_SPE_NATIVE to support this.

#define CTK_SPE_THREAD ( spe   )     ((ctk_spe_thread_t)spe)

A macro to cast SPE thread from SPE any object

#define CTK_SPE_THREAD_GROUP ( spe   )     ((ctk_spe_thread_group_t)spe)

A macro to cast SPE thread group from SPE any object

Function Documentation

static int ctk_spe_add_access_hint ( ctk_spe_t  spe,
void *  addr,
ea_size_t  size 
) [inline, static]

Adds an memory access hint (significant only for tSDK env)

Note:
The added access hints will be automatically removed when the target SPE context/thread is destroyed
Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE context or thread
[in] addr - start addr to add the memory access hint
[in] size - size of the region to add the memory access hint

static int ctk_spe_get_status ( ctk_spe_t  spe  )  [inline, static]

Returns SPE status of the given SPE object.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE any object (thread or context)
Returns:
either one of CTK_SPE_STATUS_CREATED, CTK_SPE_STATUS_LOADED, CTK_SPE_STATUS_READY, CTK_SPE_STATUS_RUNNING, CTK_SPE_STATUS_STOPPED or CTK_SPE_STATUS_UNKNOWN.

static int ctk_spe_map_ls ( ctk_spe_t  spe,
ea_addr_t *  map_addr 
) [inline, static]

Maps the LS (local storage) to the EA addr and returns the mapped addr.

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE context or thread whose LS is mapped
[out] map_addr - the mapped address
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

static int ctk_spe_map_signal1 ( ctk_spe_context_t  spe,
ea_addr_t *  map_addr 
) [inline, static]

Maps the signal notification register 1 for the SPE specified by spe and returns the mapped addr.

Note:
The address is not DMA aligned (mod 16 = 12).
Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE (context or thread) whose signal notification register is mapped
[out] map_addr - the mapped address
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

static int ctk_spe_map_signal2 ( ctk_spe_context_t  spe,
ea_addr_t *  map_addr 
) [inline, static]

Maps the signal notification register 2 for the SPE specified by spe and returns the mapped addr.

Note:
The address is not DMA aligned (mod 16 = 12).
Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE (context or thread) whose signal notification register is mapped
[out] map_addr - the mapped address
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS on success, ERRNO on failure.

static int ctk_spe_remove_access_hint ( ctk_spe_t  spe,
void *  addr 
) [inline, static]

Removes the memory access hint (only necessary if you want to remove the access hint before destroying the SPE context/thread)

Parameters:
[in] spe - the SPE context or thread
[in] hint_id - the access hint ID to be removed
